title: First Themis Test Flight Likely to Slip to 2026
summary:
The European Space Agency’s Themis programme has suffered another setback, with the inaugural flight of its reusable booster demonstrator now all but certain to slip to 2026. Adopted by ESA member states in November 2019, the Themis programme was created to develop and mature key technologies for future reusable rocket stages. At the time of […]

title: Musk-Trump dispute includes threats to SpaceX contracts
summary:
An escalating feud between President Trump and Elon Musk June 5 included threats to cancel SpaceX contracts and decommission spacecraft, although those words have yet to become actions.

title: Hubble Captures Starry Spectacle
summary: A galaxy ablaze with young stars is the subject of this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image. Named NGC 685, this galaxy is situated about 64 million light-years away in the constellation Eridanus (the River). NGC 685 is a barred spiral because its feathery spiral arms sprout from the ends of a bar of stars at […]

title: China launches fourth group of Guowang megaconstellation satellites
summary:
China launched a fourth group of satellites for its Guowang low Earth orbit megaconstellation Thursday, but released few details about the payload or objectives.
The post China launches fourth group of Guowang megaconstellation satellites appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch SXM-10 satellite for SiriusXM on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The SXM-10 satellite launch comes six months after the SXM-9 satellite was launched from Florida. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station on Friday, June 6 at 11:19 p.m. EDT (0319 UTC on June 7).

title: ispace’s Resilience lander crash lands on the Moon
summary: This was the second consecutive failed landing for the Japan-based company. A preliminary analysis points to issues with the laser altimeter.

title: Second ispace lunar lander presumed lost
summary:
Resilience, the second mission by Japanese company ispace, likely crashed attempting a landing on the moon June 5.
